alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 9:06PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A SUSPECTED ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a suspected ice jam is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Illinois, including Rock Island county. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...A suspected ice jam has resulted in some homes and other structures being impacted by rising river levels along the Rock River in Rock Island county. Depending on ice behavior, any release of the suspected ice jam could result in sudden rises of water, leading to a rapid flooding situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 851 PM CST, local law enforcement reported flooding north of the Rock River, affecting structures along River Road in the lower Friendship Farm area. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Silvis and Coal Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
